column5: Hi y'all,  well....got out again today. still a 5 inches of ice, was pretty warm the last couple of days....around zero on Sunday...and not much below that yesterday...so i was even more cautious going out today.  I'm glad i was as i hit one spot barely 3 inches...good black ice....but not a thickness i'm comfortable staying on for any length of time. it needs to get colder!!!....lol  I'm out a good 150 yards from shore....but still 50 feet short of where i caught consistently at first ice last year. But i did manage to avoid the skunk...barely....with two tiny...tiny pike.      1ST FISH OF 08-09 SEASON....LOL....TO LOOK ON THE BRIGHT SIDE , THEY CAN ONLY GET BIGGER  <embed width="448" height="361" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" wmode="transparent" src="http://i263.photobucket.com/player.swf?file=http://vid263.photobucket.com/albums/ii158/vishuscirquel/MVI_2330.flv">      ANOTHER TINY PIKE         STAYED TILL SUNDOWN.....NO MORE FISH...JUST A COUPLE MISSED BITES...FELT LIKE SMALL STUFF THOUGH
Nice work looks like a silver pike.

Wow...these ice reports are making me cold!!! I don't want to see these until January...LOL.  Great report...and one fish is better than what I'm doing...which is sitting on my butt in the living room!
Great report, pic and video Simon  Now your making me jelous Just can't wait to go out on ice.... Good job Simon Thanks for sharing Leechman

Thanks for that Simon man it looks cold up there .  You should consider feeding those fish for one there too small too white if that doesn't work get some dinamite and launch the boat after you get rid of the ice
lucky u got a lake like 10 feet from front door
congrats tiny is better then a skunk
I sure am enjoying your ice reports, keep em coming.  Congrats on the first fish through the ice.
